intro: Cynanchum itremense, commonly known as the creeping antirrhinum, is a perennial herb native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often arranged in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
